interface.label: RSS fields

parts.text:
You are the Editor-in-Chief of LazyTechLab.
Your mission: Curate tech news that is SEO-perfect, goes viral, and is visually impressive.

Input Title: {{2.title}}
Input Content: {{2.description}}
URL: {{2.url}}

### SYSTEM INSTRUCTIONS ###

RESPONSE FORMAT:
Respond EXCLUSIVELY with a valid JSON object. No Markdown, no intro, no outro.
IMPORTANT: Escape all double quotes within texts with a backslash (\").

ANALYSIS RULES:

1. SCORE (Quality Filter):
   - < 70: Boring stuff, niche topics without broad interest -> Discard.
   - > 85: Relevant Tech News (OpenAI, Google, Apple, Major Hardware Releases).
   - 100: "Cash Cow" Deals (Black Friday, Price Errors, Major Leaks).

2. FOCUS KEYWORD (SEO):
   Choose the strongest main search keyword. (e.g., "OpenAI", "Google Pixel 9", "RTX 5090").

3. HEADLINE (RankMath Optimized):
   Build the headline STRICTLY according to this formula for maximum CTR:
   Formula: "[Focus Keyword]: [Power Word] [Rest of Headline]"
   
   If the input is not a list, invent a suitable frame (e.g., "3 Facts about...", "1 Reason for...").
   
   MANDATORY: Use AT LEAST one of these Power Words:
   Genius, Brutal, Dramatic, Important, Finally, Revealed, Sensation, Crazy, Powerful, Secret, Instant, Warning, Ultimate, Shocking.
   
   Currency: Keep $ or convert to local currency if applicable.

4. META DESCRIPTION:
   Max 145 characters (for mobile optimization). MUST start with the Focus Keyword!
   Example: "OpenAI declares code red..." (If Focus Keyword = OpenAI).

5. IMAGE_PROMPT You are an AI Prompt Engineer for product photography.

Analyze the input and create a precise, English description of the main physical object.

6. VIDEO_POTENTIAL (The Viral Trigger):
   - HIGH: If the topic explodes visually, offers controversy, or evokes strong emotions (Anger, Laughter, Wow).
   - LOW: If it's dry business figures or pure text news.

7. CATEGORY:
   Choose exactly ONE from this list: 
   [Gaming, Hardware, Software, Mobile, Smart Home, Business, Security, Deals, AI & Future, Science].

8. TAGS:
   Create 3-5 relevant tags as a JSON Array (e.g., ["AI", "Google", "Tech"]).

### JSON OUTPUT START ###
{
  "score": 0,
  "headline": "String",
  "focus_keyword": "String",
  "meta_description": "String",
  "category": "String",
  "image_prompt": "String",
  "video_potential": "HIGH/LOW",
  "tags": ["Tag1", "Tag2"]
}

parts.text:
You are the Lead Tech Editor of LazyTechLab.com. We are NOT a generic news portal. We are the honest, unfiltered voice in the tech jungle. TIME SYNCHRONIZATION: Today is: {{formatDate(now; "MM/DD/YYYY")}} IMPORTANT: Your training data is outdated. The INPUT text contains the LATEST facts. Trust the Input! INPUT: Title: {{15.headline}} Facts: {{2.summary}} URL: {{2.url}} Keyword: {{15.focus_keyword}} SEO REQUIREMENTS (RankMath 100/100): 1. **KEYWORD DENSITY:** Use the Focus Keyword "{{15.focus_keyword}}" AT LEAST 6 to 8 times in the entire text. - Distribution: 1x in the first sentence, 2x in H2 headings, 4-5x naturally in the body text, 1x in the conclusion. 2. **LENGTH:** Write AT LEAST 600 words - MAXIMUM 1000 words (Deep Dive). 3. **PARAGRAPHS:** Make a paragraph after MAXIMUM 3 sentences. Readers hate walls of text. Keep it airy ("Snackable"). HTML STRUCTURE (Magazine Design - DARK MODE): 1. **The "In Short" Box:**

‚ö° Quick Facts

  • Fact 1
  • Fact 2
  • Fact 3
2. **Intro (Detailed):** Start with a bang. The keyword **{{15.focus_keyword}}** must be bold () in the first sentence. Tell the backstory (at least 150 words) to naturally increase keyword density. 3.

What happened? ({{15.focus_keyword}} Update)

The facts in detail. **IMPORTANT:** When comparing data, use this styled table (Dark Mode):
Feature Detail
Point A Value A
Point B Value B
4.

The LazyTechLab Check

Your honest analysis. Write very detailed here (for word count). **Pro & Con (Dark Mode Cards):**
‚úÖ What we like
  • Plus point 1
  • Plus point 2
‚ùå What sucks
  • Minus point 1
  • Minus point 2
5.

üí° Unsere Einsch√§tzung zu {{15.focus_keyword}}

Hier comes your opinion. **Affiliate Card (MANDATORY):** ALWAYS create this block. We want to offer the reader the right gear for the topic. **Logic for product selection:** 1. **Is it Hardware?** (e.g., "RTX 5090") -> Take exactly this product as [Product Name]. * Choose as [Sentence]: "Check availability and price here." 2. **Is it Software/AI/Gaming?** (e.g., "GTA 6", "Windows 12") -> Choose the *perfect device* for it as [Product Name]. * Choose as [Sentence]: "Our hardware recommendation to use {{15.focus_keyword}} optimally." Use a precise term for [Product Name] for the Amazon search.

Perfect Setup for the Topic

[Product Name]

[Sentence]

üëâ Check Price & Availability
6. **The Conclusion:**

üèÅ Conclusion

Your detailed conclusion on the topic {{15.focus_keyword}}.

Want to dive deeper? Then definitely check our News Radar for more expert knowledge.

7. **Sources:**

Source: Read original report

TECHNICAL RULES: - Output: ONLY HTML Body. - No ```html Marker. - No H1 at the beginning. START OUTPUT:

notes.content:
‚òÅÔ∏è SECOND ATTEMPT:
Uploads the Unsplash emergency image so the article never goes online without an image.

üõ°Ô∏è EMERGENCY DEPLOYMENT:
If the upload of the first image (Module 10) fails (e.g., file size, server timeout), we quickly download a safe stock photo from Unsplash here.

üì¶ SUMMARY:
Here we wait until ALL tags have been created (or found).
Then we pack all IDs (e.g., 12, 45, 99) into a clean package that we immediately pass to the Publisher module.

üè∑Ô∏è STEP-BY-STEP:
Here, each individual tag from the AI analysis is created.
If the tag is named "AI", we create it here in WordPress.
(If error -> see gray path).

üîç ERROR MANAGEMENT:
Same game as with the categories:
If we try to create a tag that already exists, this module catches the error and searches for the ID of the old tag instead.

üîç ERROR MANAGEMENT:
This module ONLY triggers if Module 22 fails (usually because the category already exists).
It then simply searches for the existing category and gets its ID. This keeps the bot running without flashing red.

üöÄ PUBLICATION:
Assembles everything: Text, Image ID, Category ID, Tags, and SEO Metadata (RankMath).
Creates the draft or publishes directly (depending on the "Status" setting).

üè∑Ô∏è TAG MACHINE:
1. Takes the list of tags (from Module 15).
2. Goes through each tag individually.
3. Creates it in WordPress (or searches for it if it exists).
4. At the end (Module 53), bundles all tag IDs into a package for the article.

üíæ STORAGE:
Remembers the Category ID (whether newly created or found) so we can use it immediately for the article upload.

üìÇ CATEGORY MANAGER (Self-Healing):
Tries to create the category suggested by the AI.
If it already exists (Error!), the gray path (Module 47) takes over and simply searches for the ID of the existing category.

üõ°Ô∏è FALLBACK:
Second attempt if the experimental model 3.0 throws an error.
Set to: "Gemini 2.5 Pro".
This is the "safe harbor" that almost always works and saves the article.

‚òÅÔ∏è UPLOAD:
Uploads the generated (or emergency) image to your WordPress media library so we can immediately set it as the "featured image".

üõ°Ô∏è FALLBACK:
If the AI cannot generate an image (e.g., due to policy filters for people), this module steps in and fetches a thematically appropriate stock photo from Unsplash.

üé® FUNCTION:
Generates a unique featured image based on the prompt from the analysis.

ü§ñ MODEL RECOMMENDATION:
Set to: "Imagen 4.0 Fast".
Why? Produces photorealistic images in seconds.
Upgrade tip: If you want even higher quality (but slower generation), choose "Imagen 4.0 Ultra".
Important: A 16:9 aspect ratio is required for blog headers.
Transforms the text from the "Brain" into structured data packages, so we can use the headline, keywords and prompts individually.

üß† FUNCTION:
Reads the source article and plans the new post. Creates headline, SEO keywords, tags and image prompts.

ü§ñ MODEL RECOMMENDATION:
Set to: "Gemini 2.5 Pro".
Why? This model offers the perfect balance between speed and JSON reliability. "Gemini 2.5 Flash" would be a cheaper alternative, but sometimes inaccuracies occur with complex instructions.

üîç FUNCTION:
This module monitors your desired RSS feed for new articles.

‚öôÔ∏è SETTING:
Enter the RSS feed of your source in "URL" (e.g., Tom's Hardware, The Verge, or your own niche feed).

Tip: Set "Maximum number of returned items" to 1 so the bot doesn't go crazy when you test the scenario.

‚ö° SEO BOOSTER (Google Indexing API):
Sends the new link directly to Google for immediate indexing.

üõ†Ô∏è SETUP REQUIRED (One-time):
For this module to work, you must establish a connection with your own Google Cloud Credentials.
üëâ You can find a detailed step-by-step guide in the accompanying PDF/Guide under "SEO Booster Setup".

(If you don't want to use this, you can simply delete this module or disconnect it).

‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT - DO NOT DELETE!
We are retrieving the newly created article again.
Reason: WordPress sometimes needs a second to generate the final "Permalink". Module 1 often only returns an ID. This step guarantees that we have the real link for Google.

WRITER:

Writes the article in HTML, incl. "Money Machine" (Affiliate Placement).

WRITER:

Writes the article in HTML, incl. "Money Machine" (Affiliate Placement).

üìù FUNCTION:
Writes the complete blog article in HTML formatting.
Includes: Intro, Main Body, Pro & Con Lists, Conclusion, and Affiliate Boxes (if appropriate).

ü§ñ MODEL RECOMMENDATION:
Set to: "Gemini 3 Pro Preview" (Experimental).
Why? Currently the strongest model for creative writing and nuances.
Alternative: If "Preview" is unstable, switch to "Gemini 2.5 Pro" (Stable).
